definitions.definition: (of a biochemical assay) Abbreviation of high-sensitivity.
A book, composition or any other document, written by hand (or manually typewritten), not mechanically reproduced.
A single, original copy of a book, article, composition etc, written by hand or even printed, submitted as original for (copy-editing and) reproductive publication.
Used to indicate acknowledgement or acceptance.
definitions.example: I promise to give it back. – OK.

definitions.definition: Used to introduce a sentence in order to draw attention to the importance of what is being said.
definitions.example: OK, I'm thinking of a number…

definitions.definition: Used in turn-taking, serving as a request to the speaker to grant the turn to the interrupter.
definitions.example: You always do this to me! When we were at your mother’s, you said that…  – OK, OK, …

definitions.definition: A kilobyte (more formally KB or kB).
A kilobit (more formally kb), especially in measuring Internet connection.
Kilometre or kilometres.
definitions.example: We drove 15 ks before we realised Billy wasn't in the back seat.

definitions.definition: Thousand or thousands.
definitions.example: Just about 65 k of Jack's full salary comes from servicing the Baker account.

definitions.definition: The SI measurement value of 1,000
A shorter variant of hmm.
An expression used to show contentment for something
definitions.example: Mmm, this is a tasty pie!

definitions.definition: An expression used to show thought or reflection
definitions.example: Mmm, I see what you mean.

definitions.definition: An expression used to show being muffled or not able to speak clearly, as well as "mmph".
Yes.
A period into which a year is divided, historically based on the phases of the moon.
definitions.example: July is my favourite month.

definitions.definition: A period of 30 days, 31 days, or some alternation thereof.
definitions.example: We went on holiday for two months.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) A woman's period; menstrual discharge.
As the direct object of a verb.
definitions.example: Can you hear me?

definitions.definition: Myself; as a reflexive direct object of a verb.
As the object of a preposition.
definitions.example: Come with me.

definitions.definition: As the indirect object of a verb.
definitions.example: He gave me this.

definitions.definition: Myself; as a reflexive indirect object of a verb; the ethical dative.
As the complement of the copula (be or is).
definitions.example: It wasn't me.

definitions.definition: (with and) As the subject of a verb.
definitions.example: Me and my friends played a game.

definitions.definition: (not with and) As the subject of a verb.
A kilobyte (more formally KB or kB).
A kilobit (more formally kb), especially in measuring Internet connection.
Kilometre or kilometres.

Postal service
definitions.example: USPS = United States Postal Service

definitions.definition: Public service(s)
PlayStation
Packet-switched
Paddle steamer
Power supply
Polystyrene
Initialism of post scriptum, postscriptum, postscript. (initialism written at the end of a text as a footnote)
definitions.example: PS I love you.

definitions.definition: Metric horsepower
A discipline of alpine skiing, a variant of slalom. A sport where two skiers compete head to head on parallel identical slalom courses.
An instance of the sports discipline, a course, run or competition.

Certain private schools, particularly (initially) any grammar school operated apart from the personal lands of its students or (from the 19th century) the feepaying secondary schools which developed from or were modelled upon them; a British boarding school
A college or university
(formerly Scottish) A publicly funded and administered school; such schools in the context of other countries
An image of computer or smartphone screen output at a given moment in time.
definitions.example: I grabbed a screenshot of my desktop.

definitions.definition: The name of the Latin-script letter O.
A zero (used in reading out numbers).
definitions.example: It is currently two-o-five in the afternoon (2:05 PM).

definitions.definition: The name of the Latin-script letter O.
A zero (used in reading out numbers).
definitions.example: It is currently two-o-five in the afternoon (2:05 PM).

definitions.definition: The game of tag, or it, in which the player attempting to catch the others is called "he".
The player attempting to catch the others in this game.
A male.
definitions.example: Is your cat a he or a she?

definitions.definition: (personal) A male person or animal already known or implied.
(personal, sometimes proscribed, see usage notes) A person whose gender is unknown or irrelevant.
definitions.example: The rulebook clearly states that "if any student is caught cheating, he will be expelled", and you were caught cheating, were you not, Anna?

definitions.definition: (personal) An animal whose gender is unknown.
A genderless object regarded as masculine, such as certain stars (e.g. Sun, Mercury, Mars, Jupiter) or certain ships.

synonyms: these other third-person pronouns (see "Combined forms", "Invented pronouns")

definitions.definition: The name of the Latin-script letter M.
definitions.example: The ems and ens at the beginnings and ends.

definitions.definition: A unit of measurement equal to the height of the type in use.
A greeting similar to hi.
definitions.example: Yo Paulie! How's it going?

definitions.definition: An interjection similar to hey.
definitions.example: Yo, check this out!

definitions.definition: Present! Here!
The name of the Latin-script letter O.

definitions.example: It is currently two-o-five in the afternoon (2:05 PM).

definitions.definition: One hundredth of a given value, used to measure the difference of two percentages.
definitions.example: The difference between 20 percent and 30 percent is 10 percentage points, not 10 percent. In fact, an increase from 20 to 30 percent is an increase of 50 percent. Only if, for example, 20 percent of buyers choose a certain company's products in one year and 22 percent do so the next year, can one speak of an increase of 10 percent.

To use the interjection eh
(predicative only) Of mediocre quality; unremarkable.
definitions.example: My French fries were eh.

definitions.definition: Used as a tag question, to emphasise what goes before or to request that the listener express an opinion about what has been said.
definitions.example: These hot dogs are pretty good, eh?

definitions.definition: In isolation, a request for repetition or clarification of what has just been said. Compare what, pardon.
An interjection used to ascertain the continued attention of an individual addressed by the speaker
definitions.example: I went to the restaurant, eh, but my friends didn't show up.
